moves.13... Ne4: Can´t take Blacks Knight with my c3-Knight, if I do Black retakes with the pawn, and are forking my Queen and f3-Knight.
moves.14. Nd2 Ndf6 15. Ndxe4 dxe4 16. Qc2 Re6: What? This sacrifice seems not so convincing?
moves.18. Kxh2 Ng4+: Of corse, and then will Queen h4 follow!
moves.20... Qh1+ 21. Ke2 Qxg2: Another pawn for the Bishop, and soon will probably Rook f6 follow. with pressure against my f2-pawn.
moves.23... cxd5 24. Nxd5 g5 25. Qc7: Soon White got a counter-attack. Was not so good of Black to push his f- and g-pawns.
moves.25... Qf3+ 26. Kd2 f4 27. Qg7#: Suddenly White delivers checkmate! The big mistake of Black in this game was apparently his pushing of the f- and g-pawns in front of the King. Better had been Rf6 earlier in the game!
